title: Unstable. Writing is lost.
text:
My Ex and I are required to communicate via email. EACH email is potentially EVIDENCE in our ongoing, high-conflict situation. 

Gmail has become increasingly problematic. 

Some issues seem to have to do with areas where you have spottier connectivity. (Instead of taking it slower and preserving your information, however, Gmail gets cranky and throws a tantrum)

Formatting anything increases the risks that your message will turn out wonky. (Italics seems to be much worse than Bold) Entire swaths of text can go invisible after the message is sent. There isn't necessarily an obvious rhyme or reason to what is left. 

Even just EDITING a message while not sitting still in a 5-bar or maxed Wi-Fi environment -- passing through a dead zone in a car, for instance -- can TOTALLY screw you over when you send your message from a better location!

But ultimately, YOU end up looking like an idiot, when Gmail isn't doing what it is supposed to do.

title: Filter feature not available in iOS App
text: Overall a solid app, but my one major gripe is that (as far as I can tell) the mobile app does not allow you to create or edit filters. Personally, I spend 95% of my time managing email via the mobile app (vs the web/desktop app) so this lack of functionality is very annoying to me ‚Äî the Updates folder would be way more useful to me if I could filter out emails from senders that I do not want to appear in the folder (but continually do, since I can only move emails one at a time currently). I *really* wish Google would change their strategy on the filter feature for Gmail mobile.
